definition: a wooden word-by-word reading
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
surname Xuan
to declare (publicly)/to announce
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Interactions with the TrackBall feel a little scripted compared to the app.
sentences.chinese: 互動與軌跡球覺得有點照本宣科相比應用程序。

sentences.english: Many people are complaining, though, that Obama is becoming too scripted.
sentences.chinese: 許多人都在抱怨，說奧巴馬正在變得過於照本宣科了。

sentences.english: Is it forcing the students to echo every word that the teacher says in class?
sentences.chinese: 是在教室裏按老師所說的照本宣科？

definition: to speak in general terms
cramming (as a teaching method)/rote learning
to learn by rote/to mechanically memorize
to preach
force feeding (as a teaching method)
lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation

lit. military tactics on paper (idiom)/fig. theoretical discussion that is worse than useless in practice/armchair strategist/idle theorizing/cf Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括 leading an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC
lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as a model (idiom)/fig. to copy slavishly
to parrot/to repeat uncritically what sb says
tedious/dreary
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
lesson plan/teaching plan/a "missionary case" (a dispute over Christian missionaries during the late Qing)
rigid/inflexible
